intro: Jurinea iljinii, commonly known as the Iljin's sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, featuring a compact growth form and reduced leaves to minimize water loss. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
